âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Search through open tabs â€¢ Perform common actions with few keystrokes â€¢ Boosts productivity â€¢ Supported on Chrome, Firefox, and Edge â€¢ Works on Chromium-based browsers
ðŸ“– Summary: UnTab is a browser extension designed to enhance user productivity by providing a quick and efficient way to search through open browser tabs and perform common actions using keyboard shortcuts. It aims to streamline tab management, making it easier to navigate and interact with a large number of open tabs.

ðŸŒŸ boden | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Developing cross-platform mobile applications with a native look and feel using C++.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Native widgets â€¢ Fast performance (C++17) â€¢ Cross-platform development for Android and iOS â€¢ Open framework
ðŸ“– Summary: Boden is a C++17 cross-platform GUI framework for building native Android and iOS applications. It leverages native OEM widgets for a true native look and feel, ensuring fast performance and battery efficiency.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ chaplin | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To transcribe silently mouthed words in real-time without audio input, useful for noisy environments or private communication.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Real-time silent speech recognition â€¢ Runs fully locally â€¢ Uses pre-trained VSR models â€¢ LLM integration for corrected output â€¢ Easy setup script
ðŸ“– Summary: Chaplin is a real-time, local silent speech recognition tool that uses visual lip reading to transcribe unspoken words. It leverages pre-trained models and integrates with LLMs to provide corrected text output.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ OxyMouse | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating mouse movements in Python for tasks such as testing, botting, or simulating user interactions.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Generate mouse movements using Python â€¢ Supports multiple algorithms: bezier, gaussian, perlin, oxy â€¢ Generate random coordinates within a viewport â€¢ Generate coordinates between two specific points â€¢ Generate scroll coordinates
ðŸ“– Summary: OxyMouse is a Python library designed to generate realistic and varied mouse movements. It offers multiple algorithms to simulate different types of cursor paths, making it useful for applications requiring automated mouse control or realistic user simulation.
